definition: to flatten out (paper, film, metal plates etc)
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: A nurse smoothed out the sheet and fluffed up the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 一位護士展平牀單，抖松枕頭。

sentences.english: She flattened out the crumpled letter on the desk.
sentences.chinese: 她在寫字檯上把皺巴巴的信展平。

sentences.english: G4a) The puzzles must be completely flat on the surface, with either of the two sides on top.
sentences.chinese: 魔板表面必須完全展平，正反任何一面都可以在頂面。

sentences.english: The children are taught to flatten the empty milk cartons and recycle them.
sentences.chinese: 學校教育學生將空牛奶盒展平，然後將其回收。

sentences.english: All three of these actions participate in pressing the rear foot down flat on the mat.
sentences.chinese: 所有這三個動作參與把左腳向下地板展平。

sentences.english: A two-step flattening algorithm of polygonal surfaces was proposed.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一種用於多邊形曲面的分步展平方法。

definition: welt seam (doubled over and sewed again from topside)
to sell at a 50% discount/to fold in two
venation (pattern of veins on a leaf)
